pr_title: Merging view step : to create Line between two different networks

timeline.message:
Merging view step : To create MergedLine between two networks

Signed-off-by: Thomas ADAM <tadam@silicom.fr>

timeline.bodyText:
The P0 and Q0 are equal to the half of the sum of P1 and P2 (respectively Q1 and Q2). The sign depends on the side.
If P1 and P2 are NaN, you cannot initialize these values. You probably have to listen (NetworkListener) an event and recompute them each time P1, P2, Q1, Q2 are updated.
timeline.author: mathbagu

replies.bodyText:
So, I keep Line creation with q0 & p0 equal to 0.0 (NaN are not allowed)
I implement NetworkListener::onUpdate with variantId into MergingNetworkListener and compute P0 & Q0 if P1, P2, Q1 or Q2 are updated.
How i set ucteXnodeCode ?

timeline.bodyText:
I think there is a mistake here: the sum should use absolute value: p1 and p2 have opposite sign and their values are close. So if I make the sum, I will have a value close to 0...
Example:
p1 = -605
p2 = 600
--> losses = 5
p1 + p2 / 2.0 = -2,5

Another way (simplest) way to compute the P0 and Q0 is to use the losses:
double losses = (p1 + p2)
dl1.P0 = (P1 + 1/2 losses) * sign(P2)
dl2.P0 = (P2 + 1/2 losses) * sign(P1)
